Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

Summon Construct.name: Summon Construct
Summon Construct.description:
You conjure a construct to fight for you. This works like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4YnON9JHYqtLzccu]{Summon Animal}, except you summon a common creature that has the construct trait and whose level is -1.

Heightened (2nd) Level 1

Heightened (3rd) Level 2

Heightened (4th) Level 3

Heightened (5th) Level 5

Heightened (6th) Level 7

Heightened (7th) Level 9

Heightened (8th) Level 11

Heightened (9th) Level 13

Heightened (10th) Level 15

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: Iron Taviah adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Magic Passage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to her coven's spells.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Magaambya Scar.name: Magaambya Scar
Magaambya Scar.description: Taviah has an old injury that sometimes causes her pain. A physical attack on Taviah that scores a critical hit exacerbates the injury in her wounded leg; in addition to the other effects of the critical hit, Taviah is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Bonds of Iron.name: Bonds of Iron
Bonds of Iron.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Iron Taviah can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring from nothingness around a target at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, Taviah gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal Grapple, Taviah doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature Escapes (DC 24), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it; the cage has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Iron Taviah can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed, or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Ritual Specialist.name: Ritual Specialist
Ritual Specialist.description: Iron Taviah has a +2 circumstance bonus to the primary checks to perform a ritual. In addition, she can reduce the number of secondary casters for a ritual by 1. When she does, she must fulfill any requirements for the secondary caster, and she attempts the secondary check normally performed by that secondary caster. She can't replace a secondary caster who is the target of the spell (as in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} ritual).

Scattered Coven.name: Scattered Coven
Scattered Coven.description: When the characters meet Iron Taviah, the Graveclaw is at the height of its power. As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Taviah the ability to cast the following spells as 3rd-rank occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}.

Memory Hole.name: Memory Hole
Memory Hole.disable: @Check[deception|dc:29] (master) to feed the pit false thoughts that plug it, or @Check[occultism|dc:28] (expert) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level; counteract DC 27) to drain the pit's magic
Memory Hole.hazarddescription: Anyone looking into the hole has memories sucked from their head.
Memory Hole.reset: The trap resets after 1 hour if it's not disabled.

Drink Thoughts.name: Drink Thoughts
Drink Thoughts.description:
Trigger A creature looks into the pit

Effect Ephemeral energies pour from the creature's head, and the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 hour and loses 1 minute of recent memories (a memory of the GM's choosing within the last 24 hours).

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}.

Overwhelming Ectoplasm.name: Overwhelming Ectoplasm
Overwhelming Ectoplasm.description: An ectoplasmic amalgam's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune. A creature damaged by an ectoplasmic amalgam's Strikes is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save, as the thoughts and emotions of the amalgam's constituent souls invade their mind.

Pummeling Barrage.name: Pummeling Barrage
Pummeling Barrage.description: The ectoplasmic amalgam attempts a melee Strike against each enemy within the amalgam's melee reach. Each attack counts toward the amalgam's multiple attack penalty but don't increase the amalgam's penalty until it has made all its attacks.

Spew Ectoplasm.name: Spew Ectoplasm
Spew Ectoplasm.description: The ectoplasmic amalgam releases a burst of ectoplasm that deals @Damage[16d6[bludgeoning]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic]). On a failed save, a creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure). Spew Ectoplasm functions as a force effect for the purposes of affecting incorporeal creatures. The ectoplasmic amalgam can't use Spew Ectoplasm again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Spew Ectoplasm]]{1d4 rounds}.

Corpse Scent (Imprecise).name: Corpse Scent (Imprecise)
Corpse Scent (Imprecise).description: The ghoul crocodile can smell humanoid corpses in the water up to 1 mile away.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The ghoul crocodile is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghoul crocodile devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain HP from any given corpse only once.

Death Roll.name: Death Roll
Death Roll.description:
Requirements The ghoul crocodile must have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The ghoul crocodile tucks its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting its victim. It makes a jaws Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the grabbed creature. If it hits, it also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.

Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a ghoul the next midnight

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: Any living non-elf creature hit by a ghoul crocodile's tail must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Keystone Trap.name: Keystone Trap
Keystone Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:24|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to find and press hidden knobs in a specific order (three successes are required to disable the trap, which also opens it); @Check[crafting|dc:24] (expert) to sabotage the vault's mechanisms, reducing its actions by 1 (when the trap's actions are reduced to 0, it is disabled)
Keystone Trap.hazarddescription: A 5-foot-square metal vault covered with knobs lies concealed within a stone block. A lever on the stone block slides the vault into view. When the vault is exposed-whether it's slid out or whether the stone is smashed open-the trap activates.
Keystone Trap.routine: The keystone uses its 3 actions to Electrify, Spin, and then Launch Darts. When the trap loses an action, roll randomly to determine which action it loses.

Exposed Vault.name: Exposed Vault
Exposed Vault.description:
Trigger The vault is exposed

Effect The vault makes a poison dart spray Strike at a random creature within 30 feet. The trap then rolls initiative.

Electrify.name: Electrify
Electrify.description: The metal vault crackles with electricity. In air, this would damage only creatures touching it; in water, the trap deals @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic]).

Launch Darts.name: Launch Darts
Launch Darts.description: The vault fires a stream of poisoned darts. The trap attacks all creatures in a @Template[line|distance:30] with its poison dart spray Strike; roll [[/r 1d8]] to determine the line's direction. These Strikes don't have a multiple attack penalty.

Spin.name: Spin
Spin.description: The vault spins quickly for 1 round. While it Spins, checks to disable the trap have a -2 circumstance penalty, and it Launches Darts at all creatures within 30 feet of it, rather than in a line.
